results.title: Then and Now
results.brief_description: Recounts the story of the Gaganja tribe and of an Aboriginal elder’s experience of white people entering his land.It compares the early conflict of settlement with the situation in Australia today. Winner of the category “Create a moving image stamp story” An animated short entered to “Create a Stamp Story” section of ACMI’s ‘Screen It’ media making competition for Primary Schools.

results.title: Theme development in movement education (TEFC)
results.creator_credit: Burbank Audio Visual and Glenn Kirchner
results.brief_description:
Episode number 4 of Series “Movement Education”.
Begins with a brief explanation of how to plan a short theme in a progressive and systematic way. In the second part, an extended theme of matching shapes is developed with a fourth grade class through a series of nine lessons. Shows excellent use of small and large equipment

results.title: Them!
results.creator_credit: Warner Bros Pictures, David Weisbart and Gordon Douglas
results.brief_description: Man split the atom to create the ultimate weapon not realising he would also create Them! The terror begins in the New Mexico desert when a patrolman (James Whitmore) discovers a ransacked General Store with the cash drawers untouched, the sugar supply missing and a battered corpse containing enough formic acid to kill 20 men. An FBI official and a fuddy-duddy entomologist (Edmund Gwenn) attempt to unravel the mystery. What they discover strikes terror from coast to coast: man’s atomic testing has spawned rampaging hordes of giant radiation-mutated ants, 12 feet long and capable of lifting tons. These mutants bypass the larval stage and come directly from the egg - ready to kill. In an epic death struggle, the formidable formicidae are trapped in the 700-mile storm drain network beneath fear-stricken Los Angeles and eventually beaten. A generation of films about radioactive creatures have approximated the terror but none have equalled the artistry of Them! with Academy Award nominated special effects (1954). Co-starring Joan Weldon, James Arness and Onslow Stevens. Fess Parker has a small but memorable role and look quickly for Leonard Nimoy at a teletype machine.

results.title: Them and us: a case study
results.creator_credit: Technical and Scientific Films, Film Producers Guild, Terrick Fitzhugh and Peter K. Smith
results.brief_description: A large industrial firm is used as a case study to illstrate the need for cooperation and understanding of each other’s needs between management and the representatives of employee groups. Illustrates employee representation in management.

results.title: Thelma and Louise [DVD]
results.creator_credit: Metro-Goldwyn-Mayer, Ridley Scott and Mimi Polk
results.brief_description: Fasten your seatbelts as two of Hollywood’s hottest women rev it up and take it on the road. When unhappy housewife Thelma (Geena Davis) and her wisecracking friend Louise (Susan Sarandon) decide to take a break from their lives, they embark on a trip that leads to a tragic incident at a roadside honky tonk. In an instant, their weekend “getaway” becomes just that as they flee across the American southwest with the police one step behind. A classic twist on the usual “buddy-outlaw” movie, where men are most often the unlikely heroes, this film has a charming, refreshing and triumphant outlook. Cast also includes Harvey Keitel.

results.title: Theirs is tomorrow
results.creator_credit: Herschells Films and Roy A. Driver
results.brief_description: A survey of the educational facilities provided by the Education Department in the State of Victoria. The film shows typical activities of students attending Primary, Secondary and Technical schools and at the Teachers Training College.

results.title: Theirs is the kingdom
results.brief_description: Two high school boys attempting to solve the problems of poverty in a Mexican border town, cause a near riot because of their insensitivity. Back at school one of the boys realises that the whole venture was no more than an ego trip, and tries to escape his feelings by speeding out to the desert on his bike. The bike upsets and he finds himself in the dust, alone unable to take anymore, he cries out to God. Some days later, Carl at peace, is seen alone heading back to spend a few days living among the people in the border town.

results.title: Their world (TEFC)
results.brief_description: This film explores the significance of play as a preparation for life and is an insight into child beahviour and personality. By confonting a selection of children with a “mini world” each child is invited to build his or her world using a vast assortment of tiny props. Hungarian dialogue with English subtitles.
